column2: One of your servants asked you today if he could leave to visit his dying mother before she passed. You refused, showing little concern for his pitiful issues. It seems your troubled childhood has affected your ability to empathize with others.
You've fought in more battles than you can count on the fingers you have left. You've seen men die and empires crumble before your sword. You are a true veteran of the battlefield.
You are a veteran in the fields of battle.
You've devoted much of your life to spreading the word of the [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] to everyone who would listen. You have proven to be a most pious and devout follower
You were once a missionary, spreading your religion to all corners of the world.

Before your turn to more "legitimate" ventures, you were once a thief, pilfering and pickpocketing the valuables of the nobles of your home city. Although you've moved on from such petty crime, you've learned many valuable skills that will stay with for life.
You were once an accomplished thief.
